page.title: 07FARMS
page.content: Mr.Hutchinson owns two farms adjoining each other,West Moor Farm and Aislaby Grange.The farm stretches for about 2 kilometres from West Moor to Aislaby Grange and down to the River Tees. One hundred and thirteen hectares make up the farm,three-quarters of the land growing crops and the rest for grassland. At the time of our visit Mr.Hutchinson had 160 lambs,90 sheep,50 beef cattle,6 calves,4 horses and 3 foals.The length of his day varies according to the season,from 5.30am to 10.00pm. The house and buildings of West Moor Farm have been used for farming since at least 1575.
